rule-19-15-a.test_description: Baseline system type 10, minimum ventilation does not exceed auto-sized airflow rates. Suppy airflow rates are correctly based on the temperature difference between 105F and the design space-heating temperature set point.

Baseline system type 10, minimum ventilation does not exceed auto-sized airflow rates. Supply airflow rates are correctly based on the temperature difference between 105F and the design space-heating temperature set point.

standard.rule_description: For baseline system types 9 & 10, the system design supply airflow rates  shall be based on the temperature difference between a supply air temperature set point of 105°F and the design space-heating temperature set point, the minimum outdoor airflow rate, or the airflow rate required to comply with applicable codes or accreditation standards, whichever is greater.

rule-19-15-b.test_description: Baseline system type 10, minimum ventilation does not exceed auto-sized airflow rates. Suppy airflow rates are incorrectly based on a supply-air-to-room temperature set-point difference of 20F.
Baseline system type 10, minimum ventilation does not exceed auto-sized airflow rates. Supply airflow rates are incorrectly based on a supply-air-to-room temperature set-point difference of 20F.

standard.rule_description: For baseline system types 9 & 10, the system design supply airflow rates  shall be based on the temperature difference between a supply air temperature set point of 105°F and the design space-heating temperature set point, the minimum outdoor airflow rate, or the airflow rate required to comply with applicable codes or accreditation standards, whichever is greater.

rule-19-15-c.test_description: Baseline system type 9, minimum ventilation exceeds the auto-sized airflow rates. Suppy airflow rates are correctly based on the minimum ventilation airflow rates.
Baseline system type 9, minimum ventilation exceeds the auto-sized airflow rates. Supply airflow rates are correctly based on the minimum ventilation airflow rates.

standard.rule_description: For baseline system types 9 & 10, the system design supply airflow rates  shall be based on the temperature difference between a supply air temperature set point of 105°F and the design space-heating temperature set point, the minimum outdoor airflow rate, or the airflow rate required to comply with applicable codes or accreditation standards, whichever is greater.

rule-19-15-d.test_description: Baseline system type 9, minimum ventilation exceeds the auto-sized airflow rates. Suppy airflow rates are incorrectly based on the temperature difference between 105F and the design space-heating temperature set point.

Baseline system type 9, minimum ventilation exceeds the auto-sized airflow rates. Supply airflow rates are incorrectly based on the temperature difference between 105F and the design space-heating temperature set point.

standard.rule_description: For baseline system types 9 & 10, the system design supply airflow rates  shall be based on the temperature difference between a supply air temperature set point of 105°F and the design space-heating temperature set point, the minimum outdoor airflow rate, or the airflow rate required to comply with applicable codes or accreditation standards, whichever is greater.

rule-19-15-e.test_description: Baseline system type 9 with more than one supply fan.

standard.rule_description: For baseline system types 9 & 10, the system design supply airflow rates  shall be based on the temperature difference between a supply air temperature set point of 105°F and the design space-heating temperature set point, the minimum outdoor airflow rate, or the airflow rate required to comply with applicable codes or accreditation standards, whichever is greater.
